001package imagingbook.lib.util.choice;
002
003import java.util.LinkedList;
004import java.util.List;
005
006/**
007 * This is the core of a scheme to collect and instantiate dedicated subclasses
008 * ("choices") of a given class or interface.
009 * <p>
010 * The <strong>traditional</strong> scheme (see {@link ExampleTraditional}) requires the following steps:
011 * </p>
012 * <ol>
013 * <li>Define a superclass (or interface) with a set of nested, concrete
014 * subclasses that are to be instantiated after being chosen by the user.</li>
015 * <li>Available choices are specified by an {@code enum} type, which maps to
016 * the associated subclasses.</li>
017 * <li>Dispatching (i.e., dynamic instantiation of choices) is done by a switch
018 * over all enum-values or by the enum elements themselves.</li>
019 * </ol>
020 * <p>
021 * The <strong>proposed scheme</strong> (see {@link ExampleWithChoices}) works as follows:
022 * <ol>
023 * <li>Define a superclass (or interface) with a set of nested, concrete
024 * subclasses that are to be instantiated after being chosen by the user.</li>
025 * <li>Selected subclasses are marked with a {@link DeclareChoice} annotation. To
026 * be accepted as a choice, a subclass must fulfill the following requirements:
027 * <ul>
028 * <li>The subclass definition must be {@code static}, so it can be instantiated
029 * without a containing class instance.</li>
030 * <li>The subclass must extend its containing class.</li>
031 * <li>The subclass must carry a {@link DeclareChoice} annotation. A runtime
032 * exception may occur if a subclass is annotated but does not satisfy the above
033 * requirements.
034 * </ul>
035 * </li>
036 * <li>Static methods defined in {@link Choices} allow listing and instantiation
037 * of the defined choices in a given containing class. There is no need for a
038 * separate {@code enum} type.</li>
039 * </ol>
040 * <p>
041 * A descriptive name ({@code String}) for the choice item may be passed to the
042 * {@link DeclareChoice} annotation, which my be retrieved at runtime with
043 * {@link #getChoiceName(Class)}.
044 * </p>
045 * <p>
046 * This is defined as an interface to be implemented by enclosing classes
047 * (with additional functionality) in the future.
048 * Note that this code is still experimental!
049 * </p>
050 * <p>
051 * See {@link ExampleWithChoices} for a simple usage example:
052 * </p>
053 * 
054 * @author WB
055 * @version 2020/11/03
056 *
057 */
058public interface Choices {
059        
060        /**
061         * Searches the specified class or interface for inner classes marked
062         * as 'choices' by a {@link DeclareChoice} annotation.
063         * An array of subclasses is returned, which may be empty.
064         * 
065         * @param <E> the type of the containing class (or interface)
066         * @param outerClass the class (or interface) containing the choice subclasses
067         * @return array of subclasses, which may be empty
068         */
069        public static <E> Class<? extends E>[] getChoices(Class<E> outerClass) {
070                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
071                Class<? extends E>[] subclasses = (Class<? extends E>[]) outerClass.getDeclaredClasses();
072                List<Class<? extends E>> choices = new LinkedList<>();
073                
074                for (Class<? extends E> sc : subclasses) {
075                        if (isChoice(outerClass, sc)) {
076                                choices.add(sc);
077                        }
078                }
079                
080                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
081                Class<? extends E>[] arr = (Class<? extends E>[]) new Class<?>[choices.size()];
082                return choices.toArray(arr);
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Checks if the specified class is a choice class.
087         * 
088         * @param choiceClass the potential choice class
089         * @return true if a choice class
090         */
091        public static boolean isChoice(Class<?> choiceClass) {
092                Class<?> enclosingClass = choiceClass.getEnclosingClass();
093                if (enclosingClass == null) {   // there is no enclosing class
094                        return false;
095                }
096                else
097                        return isChoice(enclosingClass, choiceClass);
098        }
099        
100        /**
101         * Checks if the specified class is a choice class within the given
102         * enclosing class.
103         * 
104         * @param enclosingClass the enclosing class
105         * @param choiceClass the potential (inner) choice class
106         * @return true if a choice class
107         */
108        public static boolean isChoice(Class<?> enclosingClass, Class<?> choiceClass) {
109                return
110                        choiceClass.isAnnotationPresent(DeclareChoice.class) &&
111                        choiceClass.isMemberClass() && 
112                        enclosingClass.isAssignableFrom(choiceClass) &&
113                        hasConstructor(choiceClass);
114        }
115        
116        static <E> boolean hasConstructor(Class<E> clazz) {
117                boolean hasConstr = false;
118                try {
119                        clazz.getConstructor();
120                        hasConstr = true;
121                } catch (NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) { }
122                if (!hasConstr) {
123                        throw new RuntimeException(String.format(
124                                        "getChoices: class %s has no constructor, must be declared static!", clazz.getName()));
125                }
126                return hasConstr;
127        }
128        
129        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
130        
131        /**
132         * Returns the name of a specified single choice class. The result is its simple class name or
133         * the descriptive name specified by the associated {@link DeclareChoice} annotation.
134         * Throws a runtime exception if the specified class is not a choice class.
135         * 
136         * @param <E> the type of the choice class
137         * @param choiceClass the choice class
138         * @return the (optional) descriptive name specified by the associated {@link DeclareChoice} annotation,
139         * otherwise the simple name of the class. 
140         */
141        public static <E> String getChoiceName(Class<E> choiceClass) {
142                DeclareChoice annot = choiceClass.getAnnotation(DeclareChoice.class);
143                if (annot == null) {
144                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("class " + choiceClass.getSimpleName() + " is no valid choice");
145//                      return null;
146                }
147                String annotValue = annot.value();
148                if (annotValue.isEmpty()) {
149                        return choiceClass.getSimpleName();
150                }
151                else {
152                        return annotValue;
153                }
154        }
155        
156        /**
157         * Returns an array of choice names (see {@link #getChoiceName(Class)})
158         * for the specified containing class.
159         * 
160         * @param <E> the generic type of the containing class
161         * @param outerClass the choice class
162         * @return an array of choice names
163         */
164        public static <E> String[] getChoiceNames(Class<E> outerClass) {
165                Class<? extends E>[] choices = getChoices(outerClass);
166                String[] names = new String[choices.length];
167                for (int i = 0; i < choices.length; i++) {
168                        //names[i] = choices[i].getSimpleName();
169                        names[i] = getChoiceName(choices[i]);
170                }
171                return names;
172        }
173        
174        // --------------------------------------------------------
175        
176        public static <E> Class<? extends E> getChoiceForName(Class<E> outerClass, String name) {
177                Class<? extends E>[] choices = getChoices(outerClass);
178                Class<? extends E> choice = null;
179                for (int i = 0; i < choices.length; i++) {
180                        if (name.equals(choices[i].getSimpleName())) {
181                                choice = choices[i];
182                                break;
183                        }
184                }
185                if (choice == null) {
186                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("class " + outerClass.getSimpleName() + " defines no choice " + name);
187                }
188                return choice;
189        }
190        
191        
192        /**
193         * Creates and returns a new instance of the specified choice class.
194         * Throws a runtime exception if the specified class is not a choice class.
195         * 
196         * @param <E> the generic type of the enclosing class
197         * @param choiceClass the choice class
198         * @return a new instance 
199         */
200        public static <E> E getInstance(Class<? extends E> choiceClass) { 
201                E instance = null;
202                try {
203                        instance = choiceClass.newInstance();
204                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException e) {
205                        e.printStackTrace();
206                }
207                return instance;
208        }
209
210}
